vision.notes: Nocturnal or crepuscular birds, suggesting good low-light vision. Plumage coloration provides camouflage, and contrasting pale patches or spots are likely used for intraspecific communication.

hearing.notes: Nocturnal behavior suggests an importance of auditory cues, likely for detecting insect prey and possibly for communication.

mechanoreception.notes: Rictal bristles are present in typical nightjars, likely used to detect insects during flight. Also sensitive to touch for roosting.

chemoreception.notes: Role of smell is not mentioned in source. Difficult to confidently assert prevalence.
